questions.question_text: What is a valid option when exporting a custom image?

discussion.content:
A is correct:Pre-Authenticated Requests
When using import/export across tenancies, you need to use an Object Storage pre-authenticated request. See Working with Pre-Authenticated Requests for steps to create a pre-authenticated request. When you go through these steps, after you click Create Pre-Authenticated Request, the Pre-Authenticated Request Details dialog box opens. You must make a copy of the pre-authenticated request URL displayed here, because this is the only time this URL is displayed. This is the Object Storage URL that you specify for import/export.
A is correct
A is correct, Create a PreAith.Request, and use the Given URL
A is the right answer.
A is right

A is correct !
Explanation: You can use the Console or API to export images, and the exported images are stored in the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Object Storage service. 
To perform an image export, you need write access to the Object Storage bucket for the image.

Reference: https://docs.cloud.oracle.com/iaas/Content/Compute/Tasks/imageimportexport.htm
D is the correct choice

Correct is A and D.
https://docs.cloud.oracle.com/en-us/iaas/Content/Network/Tasks/managingVNICs.htm

The primary vNIC cannot be removed. A floating IP cannot be assigned to a vNIC.

comments.content:
seconday vNIC I mean. Here's proof:

https://docs.cloud.oracle.com/en-us/iaas/Content/Network/Tasks/managingpublicIPs.htm

from the same documentation
A given instance can have multiple secondary VNICs, and a given VNIC can have multiple secondary private IPs. So you can assign a given instance multiple public IPs across one or more VNICs if you like.

discussion.content: correct A and B

A & B
Reason for A: You can add secondary VNICs to an instance after it's launched. Each secondary VNIC can be in a subnet in the same VCN as the primary VNIC, or in a different subnet that is either in the same VCN or a different one. However, all the VNICs must be in the same availability domain as the instance.
Reason for B: from oracle documentation: A given instance can have multiple secondary VNICs, and a given VNIC can have multiple secondary private IPs. So you can assign a given instance multiple public IPs across one or more VNICs if you like.

A y D)
"About Secondary VNICs
You can add secondary VNICs to an instance after it's launched. Each secondary VNIC can be in a subnet in the same VCN as the primary VNIC, or in a different subnet that is either in the same VCN or a different one. 
However, all the VNICs must be in the same availability domain as the instance."

comments.content: B - When you add a secondary VNIC to an instance, you choose whether the primary private IP on the new VNIC gets an ephemeral public IP. This choice is available only if the secondary VNIC is in a public subnet.

discussion.content:
Answer is A, B
A - The secondary VNIC must be in the same availability domain as the instance's primary VNIC, so the subnet list includes any regional subnets or AD-specific subnets in the primary VNIC's availability domain. <https://docs.cloud.oracle.com/en-us/iaas/Content/Network/Tasks/managingVNICs.htm>

B - https://docs.cloud.oracle.com/en-us/iaas/Content/Network/Tasks/managingpublicIPs.htm#:~:text=You%20cannot%20move%20an%20ephemeral,IP%20in%20the%20same%20region.
A & B - anytime :)

To assign an ephemeral public IP when creating a secondary VNIC
When you add a secondary VNIC to an instance, you choose whether the primary private IP on the new VNIC gets an ephemeral public IP. This choice is available only if the secondary VNIC is in a public subnet.

questions.question_text:
You are managing a tier-1 OLTP application on an Autonomous Transaction Processing (ATP) database. Your business needs to run hourly batch processes on this ATP database that may consume more CPUs than what is available on the server.
How can you limit these batch processes to not interfere with the OLTP transactions?

choices.C: Disable automated backup during the batch process operations
choices.B: ATP is designed for OLTP workload only; you should not run batch processes on ATP
choices.A: Copy OLTP data into new tables in a new table space and run batch processes against these new tables
choices.D: Configure ATP resource management rules to manage runtime and IO consumption for the consumer group of batch processes

questions.question_text: Which three can you achieve by using Terraform? (Choose three.)

discussion.content: A,B and D are correct options
A,B,D is correct
A b and d are correct

choices.D: Automatically destroy all the resources that are in tenancy.
choices.A: Create resources in the right order without regard to the order in the terraform plan file.
choices.C: Automatically translate a deployed infrastructure and create a plan.
choices.B: Automatically re-provision the resources that are tainted or whose configuration has changed.
choices.E: Continuously maintain the configuration files in an instance.

choices.D: You can create on-demand one-off backups of block volumes, but not boot volumes
choices.C: You can create on-demand one-off backups of boot volumes, but not block volumes
choices.A: You can create clones of storage volumes one at a time
choices.B: You can group together multiple storage volumes in a volume group and create volume group backups

discussion.content: B is the answer
B is the right answer. same question in practice test too
B, has to be !
B is right
Volume group - "B " it is!
B is the correct Answer

B is the right answer.
Same question in the practice test.
I also support "B", group volumn will be most efficient way to create backup of all resources together.
volume groups u can use for to apply any backup/restore in bundle

questions.question_text:
You are responsible for creating and maintaining an enterprise application that consists of multiple storage volumes across multiple instances. The storage volumes include boot volumes and block volumes for your data storage. You need to create backups of these storage volumes in the most time-efficient manner.
How can you meet this requirement?
